Articles.Content: I am looking for some vehicle or plane which go every biome on kerbin. (i need science point)

Hello,

You have a lot of biomes (33) right at KSC. Add the Kerbin's Shore just around the KSC, the water about 2km out the runway and the grassland about 5km away, you got 36 biomes available just with a small rover.

Anyway to  go farther, you can try a VTOL or a very small low speed conventional plane.

See you,

Vive_moi
This information i have. I need some vehicle which can visit this biom

Apart from what @Vive_moi said, there's also the highlands and the mountains just a couple dozen kilometers west of KSC. Two more biomes, reachable in a minute or two with pretty much any plane that can lift off at all.

Minus those two, there'll be only four other biomes left on Kerbin you haven't visited: tundra, poles, desert, badlands. All of which are super far away - at minimum a quarter around the planet. Considering you'll already have farmed 38 others? This is so not worth your time. Literally anything else you can do gives you more science for less effort. Sometimes ten times as much science for one tenth the effort.

I recommend a low altitude Mun flyby Can easily be done with unlocking only the first two tech nodes, and I suspect you have unlocked many more than that.

Edited March 2, 2017 by Streetwind
Of course, desert is easy enough to get on reentry, it's a pretty big stretch to aim for on the equator.

Streetwind, there are no "poles" -- it's Ice Caps . And there are now also the Northern Ice Shelf, and Southern Ice Shelf (they are new in 1.2).

But there are only 14 available at KSC at the beginning of the game. And all the natural biomes are currently available both splashed and landed. So that makes 14 KSC biomes vs 22 natural biomes. And splashed experiments are worth more than the others. So that is one reason to go out and get them -- you get twice as many science points to buy tech with. Another is that Kerbin is a Celestial Body, and the game is about exploring celestial bodies to find out what's there.

To the OP's question:

any airplane can get you to all the natural biomes. You have to go into the water for half of them, so it's good if the plane can land and take off from water. Canard wing planes are all pretty good at this. You also need to land in bumpy places, so having big wings and strong wheels is very useful. The stock planes are not very good, but they can do the job. Do you really just want a picture or a craft file of a plane that can fly better than the stock planes? Or do you have the stock ones turned off and not want to use them?

Once you have the variometer, being able to fly very high is also useful. So getting a panther engine (perhaps on a contract) is handy.
One more qvestion. I use mode x sience. How can finde biom xxx on kerbean or how can navigation on this  position

47 minutes ago, bewing said:

there are now also the Northern Ice Shelf, and Southern Ice Shelf (they are new in 1.2).

Ah? I did not know that, since I usually don't bother scraping every last science point off of Kerbin when other destinations are so much more rewarding. I never bothered to look. Guess I will go look now!

And how? Can you give me some tutorial where can find biom and select him ??

 

I have problem: I take mission go on this biom and do this experiment ok but where is this biom if i click on M i cant see eny point

 

Edited March 2, 2017 by Avarax

Mostly, you just fly around with KerbNet turned on, and watch the biomes as they go by undreneath you. If you want to select one, you pause the game, move the KerbNet cursor to the biome you want, name the location, and create a waypoint. Using KerbNet is discussed in KSPedia, and I know there is at least one youtube video that shows it a little.

can you give me link pls ? And one more plroblem i dont have kerbnet

Edited March 2, 2017 by Avarax

7 hours ago, bewing said:

 Another is that Kerbin is a Celestial Body, and the game is about exploring celestial bodies to find out what's there.

Maybe for you, for me its more about orbital mechanics. The question is: what the game is about for the OP? I mean, he want to complete the collection or just get some science?

6 hours ago, Avarax said:

And how? Can you give me some tutorial where can find biom and select him ??

{x]Science, Kerbal Engineer and MechJeb among other mods will tell you in each biome you are in. With those (and the KerbNet) you can go around and look for unexplored biomes).

allow for creating custom waypoints, and someone shared a file wayponts for kerbin biomes.

and

allow for the creation of biome maps.
